questions.question: Would you mind ................................ for an hour?
questions.description: Would you mind is followed by a noun or an ing form.

questions.question: I was hoping you ...................................... spare me a few minutes.
questions.description: We use a past tense after I was hoping.

questions.question: Do you mind if I .................................. some music?
questions.description: Do you mind…? is followed by a verb in the present tense. Would you mind…? is followed by a verb in the past tense.

questions.question: Would you mind if I ................................... the window?
questions.description: Do you mind…? is followed by a verb in the present tense. Would you mind…? is followed by a verb in the past tense.

questions.question: When ................................. up in the morning?
questions.description: The simple present tense is used to talk about our everyday activities.

questions.question: My sister ...................................... in Switzerland.
questions.description: We use the simple present to talk about facts.

questions.question: I usually drink coffee in the morning, but today I ................................. tea.
questions.description: The simple past is used to talk about something that happened on one particular occasion.

questions.question: He ................................... not like vegetables, but he ............................. fruits.
questions.description: When the subject is a singular noun or pronoun, we use does in the simple present tense.

questions.question: He .................................... his car in the garage.
questions.description: The present continuous is used to talk about actions and situations that are going on at the moment of speaking.

questions.question: The puppy ................................ in pain because it has hurt its leg.
I ................................. many setbacks in life.
questions.description: The present perfect is used to talk about finished past events when there is no reference to time.

questions.question: One day we ……………………………… colonize Mars.
questions.description: We cannot use can to talk about future ability. Instead we use will be able to.

questions.question: She has no interest …………………………. politics.
questions.description: Interest is followed by the preposition in.

questions.question: I was happy ……………………….. my old friends again.
questions.description: We use a to-infinitive after happy.

questions.question: Parents must discourage children ……………………………. unhealthy habits.
questions.description: We use from + ing form after discourage.

questions.question: She is your neighbor, …………………………?
questions.description: We use a negative tag after an affirmative statement.

questions.question: It was …………………………… that we did not go out.
questions.description: We use ‘so + adjective / adverb + article + noun’ in this pattern.

questions.question: It is time you …………………………… to home.
questions.description: We use a past tense with a present meaning after it is time.

questions.question: The driver was …………………………. injured in the accident.
questions.description: Fatally is the adverb. Deadly is an adjective.

questions.question: I recommend ……………………….. go on a diet.
questions.description: We can use a that-clause after recommend. A to-infinitive is not possible.

questions.question: They made me …………………………. the whole story.
questions.description: We cannot use a to-infinitive after make.

questions.question: If I knew his real motive, I ………………………….. this.
questions.description: In the second conditional, we use a simple past in the if-clause and would + infinitive in the main clause.

questions.question: She is not the right candidate for the job, ................................?
He asked me to ....................................... him one thousand dollars.
